title: My computer crashed running my BeaconNode - Critical Process Error and Memory Management
body:
The last issue was my Dad's Node. His validator has been confirming deposit since Monday and he is losing Ethereum. This is an outrage. His Node is 1883. Mine is 3069. This is a seperate outrage in that my computer went blue screen on memory management. Then I got a critical process error and I have to re-install Windows. What is going on here! Justin Chapman # üêû Bug Report ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ## üî• Error
## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:**
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)**
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**

I understand your dad (validator 1883) is not active. 
Can you provide any details? 
What version of Prysm are you running? 
Can you share any logs in your beacon node or validator? 
Are there any errors?

For your validator 3069, I understand you reinstalled windows. Is there still an issue?

It's still waiting been waiting for 5 days

What is this public key `0xb4e55bd91193`? 

It's not validator 1883 (`0x8031a3d23db9d7d3ed733cb7daaca8368de476ee14d53ea8962d7970be433041dc3db253cf0a1b34a8497abdb8ddcd57`).

and it's not 3069 (`0xa8813256536de76870d9bc94dec6ff16614fc2461b25a5ddc4aa809530665786cba531ea98fc53f9e472489162b21a84`).

I have no idea that's a good question
I just used the keystore that was saved post-deposit
Thanks for your quick feedback
I am about to re-install WIndows after mine crashed and re-boot my validator node.  I have been getting penalized all day.
Do I need to access my Dad's keystore and insert the correct validator key into the public key section or will that break the keystore file for his deposit key
I think that is the issue. You'll need to restore the validator client with the correct keystore to start validating again.

In the keystore JSON file right?
Where it says "description": "", "pubkey": "........................ that's where I type my Dad's Validator Node Public Key?
Inside the JSON Keystore-m file?
Thanks again!
About to try

> Do I need to access my Dad's keystore and insert the correct validator key into the public key section or will that break the keystore file for his deposit key

First thing you'll want to do is to make sure your Dad's keys are not running on any other machine. If you run your Dad's validator and he runs it too, then you could get slashed. 

When you import the validator keys from the launchpad keystore, it doesn't modify the original keystore file. Prysm loads the JSON file, decrypts it with the provided password, then creates a new wallet in prysm with a new password.

> Where it says "description": "", "pubkey": "........................ that's where I type my Dad's Validator Node Public Key?

There is no typing of public keys. You'll need to find the correct keystore, you do not modify the json file!
I went in the JSON script and replaced the wrong public ID with my Dad's and it worked

Unbelivable for some reason it had the wrong public ID - What is this public key 0xb4e55bd91193
The keystore file

With mine I am very concerned about the memory mamagement error and critical process error 
WHen I re-install WIndows I will reach back out with feedback.  I have an external D Drive that has 16TB HD

> I went in the JSON script and replaced the wrong public ID with my Dad's and it worked

I don't think this worked. You might have seen the public key printed when you completed the import, but the secret key in the keystore will not match.

https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/01bf97293feae72ad8298bf670352927629321bd/validator/keymanager/imported/import.go#L106-L113

Can you please reach out on discord? I'm very concerned about your situtation. https://discord.gg/z9efH7e
It isn't working you're right this is awful
The validator is running but not attesting
Why would we receive a keystore with a validation public address different than my Dad's validation address
Please reach out on discord and we can help you there. https://discord.gg/z9efH7e
We connected on discord and resolved this offline. The user's account was recovered successfully from their mnemonic phrases.
